alert.note: Alert for Kauai Southwest; Kohala; Kona; Molokai West; Waianae Coast (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 16 at 3:36PM HST until January 18 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU AND THE BIG ISLAND AND FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... .A north (340-360 degrees) swell will maintain large surf along north facing shores of most islands tonight. As this swell declines on Wednesday, a west-northwest (300-310 degree) swell will arrive, maintaining large surf along north shores from Kauai to Maui and producing elevated surf along west facing shores of Kauai, Oahu, Molokai, and the Big Island through Thursday. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM WEDNESDAY TO 6 PM HST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Along west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, and Molokai, surf will build to 12 to 16 feet Wednesday. Along west facing shores of the Big Island, surf will build to 6 to 8 feet Wednesday afternoon. * WHERE...Kauai Southwest, Waianae Coast, Kona, Kohala and Molokai West. * WHEN...From 6 AM Wednesday to 6 PM HST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.

area.areaDesc: Kauai Southwest; Kohala; Kona; Molokai West; Waianae Coast
